subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: My take on this ridiculous MiniBox War 07' on here
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
--_7cbb8e9a-ff8b-4c69-88c1-f516205d18c4_

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


 I'll have to back the haunted bus up just a bit. I did a recording at the=
 Lumber Baron here, last year(?!) and posted some of those files just now, =
which seems to support the idea of spirits either staying there, or stuck t=
here. I don't remember if I brought a box and ran my own session, or if I d=
id this session at home later. What I got very much conflicted with what wa=
s accepted as the real haunting. Not too many seemed interested in my versi=
on.   I need to get out more and do some field work.  With The Mini Box ava=
ilable, I feel less compelled to try to put mine into production, so don't =
have to feel forced to spend every waking minute building stuff.   I don't =
care who makes the things, it's great to have the technology available to a=
nyone that can afford it. The stress has been lifted--THANK YOU Ron Rickett=
s!  I'll keep working toward a production model, but want to do some design=
 changes. Battery weight is a problem, and reception in remote areas is a p=
roblem. 
 
 How 'bout this, a pocket model that you go around a site with, =
listening to headphones! =3D:-0. If I had a supply of older digital Walkman=
s, I could make a sweep adapter that would go in the tape compartment. Just=
 another old man's crackhead idea.......maybe. Like I said, the possiblitie=
s are endless. 
 
   Frank-S

 I'll have to back the haunted bus up just a bit. I d=
id a recording at the Lumber Baron here, last year(?!) and posted=
 some of those files just now, which seems to support the idea of spir=
its either staying there, or stuck there. I don't remember if I brough=
t a box and ran my own session, or if I did this session at home later. Wha=
t I got very much conflicted with what was accepted as the real haunting. N=
ot too many seemed interested in my version. <BR> <BR> I need to =
get out more and do some field work.<BR> <BR> With The Mini =
Box available, I feel less compelled to try to put mine into production,&nb=
sp;so don't have to feel forced to spend every waking minute building stuff=
.   I don't care who makes the things, it's great to have the technolo=
gy available to anyone that can afford it. The stress has been lifted--THAN=
K YOU Ron Ricketts!<BR> <BR> I'll keep working toward a productio=
n model, but want to do some design changes. Battery weight is a problem, a=
nd reception in remote areas is a problem. <BR>
 <BR>
 How 'bout =
this, a pocket model that you go around a site with, listening to head=
phones! =3D:-0. If I had a supply of older digital Walkmans, I could m=
ake a sweep adapter that would go in the tape compartment. Just anothe=
r old man's crackhead idea.......maybe. Like I said, the possiblities are e=
ndless. <BR>
 <BR>
 <BR> <BR> Frank-S<BR><BR><BR><BR>
